history.content: If you were exactly 0.78 above for the whole class, and the scores were exactly normally distributed, you'd be in the top 22ish%. That would probably be an A based on the past two semesters, albeit pretty close to the border. Your grade probably comes down to correlative/skew factors that you can't really predict though. Good luck :)

If you were exactly 0.78 above for the whole class, and the scores were exactly normally distributed, you'd be in the top 21%. That would probably be an A based on the past two semesters, albeit pretty close to the border. Your grade probably comes down to correlative/skew factors that you can't really predict though. Good luck :)

If you were exactly 0.78 above for the whole class, and the scores were exactly normally distributed, you'd be in the top 21%. That probably would be an A, albeit pretty close to the border. Your grade probably comes down to correlative/skew factors that you can't really predict though. Good luck :)
What SDs will correlate to an A? Would like 0.78 SD be enough, historically?
history.subject: EECS70 grade distribution
